business.headline: Explained: Why foreign portfolio investors are buying Indian financial stocksData from the National Securities Depository shows FPIs bought Rs 18,409 crore ($2.18 billion) worth of shares in the sector last month, propelling the Nifty Financial Services index to a 4.1% gain.

Scotch whisky prices set to drop after India-UK trade deal. Details hereThe reduction is expected to bring premium and mid-range Scotch whiskies within reach of a larger section of Indian consumers. A bottle that typically costs Rs 5,000 could soon be priced between Rs 3,500 and Rs 4,000 following the initial tariff cut.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Sensex, Nifty rebound as markets stay calm after 'Operation Sindoor'The Sensex fell sharply in pre-opening, but recovered as soon as the markets opened at 9:15 am. At around 9:30 am, Sensex was trading 143.08 points higher at 80,784.15, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 56.60 points to trade at 24,432.

Paytm nears full profitability; revenue grows to Rs 1,911 crorePaytm's revenue increased by 5% quarter-on-quarter, reaching Rs 1,911 crore, reflecting the company's steady performance and continued momentum in its core businesses.

Need a personal loan? Unlock Rs 5 lakh instantly using just your PAN cardTo apply online, you simply visit the bank or lender's website and fill out the application form. You'll need to provide your name, date of birth, mobile number, and PAN number.

Sensex ends 156 points lower, Nifty below 24,400; Adani Enterprises falls 4%The BSE Sensex ended 155.77 points lower at 80,641.07, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 81.55 points to settle at 24,379.60. Most of the broader market indices also declined during the trading session due to high selling pressure.

Yes Bank denies reports of stake sale to Japan's SMBC, calls it 'speculative'The private sector lender clarified that while it regularly explores business opportunities, there is nothing material to disclose under current regulatory norms.

Saying yes to a joint loan? Here's how it can affect your credit scoreEvery time an EMI is paid on time, it reflects positively on both borrowers' credit profiles. Over time, this builds your credit score. If you were added as a co-applicant to help someone get a loan because your own score was low, this is your chance to improve it.

ITR filing 2025: 5 common mistakes you must avoid while filing your tax returnsUsing the wrong ITR form can delay your tax processing or, worse, your return may get rejected. Also, filing your ITR is not the final step, you must also verify it.

Is the worst over for global economy as Trump eases stance on tariffs?Even as Trump suggests deals are near with countries like India, Japan, and South Korea, and China reviews a fresh proposal from Washington, the global economy isn't breathing easy yet.

Opted for new tax regime? Here's a look at key benefits, what you can claimThe government brought in the new tax regime to make things simpler for taxpayers. It gives you more tax slabs with lower rates, which means you may end up paying less tax.

entertainment.headline: Fighter's fight begins: Rajinikanth supports India's Operation Sindoor against terrorSuperstar Rajinikanth reacted to India's mission against Pakistan-backed terrorism, code-named Operation Sindoor. He wrote that the entire nation is with Prime Minister Narendra Modi.

Total justice: Akshay Kumar to Kangana Ranaut, celebs on Operation SindoorOn May 7, India launched Operation Sindoor, attacking nine terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Several Bollywood celebrities, including Akshay Kumar, Kangana Ranaut and Suniel Shetty, among others, have reacted to the mission.

Kabir Khan opens up about creative differences with Salman Khan during Ek Tha Tiger shootDirector Kabir Khan shared insights into the challenges faced while working with Salman Khan on the set of 'Ek Tha Tiger'. He revealed that the film wasn't entirely under his control due to creative differences.

Raid 2 box office Day 6: Ajay's film sees good run on weekdays, nears Rs 90 crore'Raid 2', starring Ajay Devgn and Riteish Deshmukh, is slowly moving closer to the benchmark of Rs 100 crore at the box office. The film has got two more days to work well until a new film releases on Friday.

Diljit Dosanjh takes ChatGPT's help in BTS video with Shakira: I'm learning EnglishDijit Dosanjh used ChatGPT's help to learn English in BTS video with Shakira and Nicole Scherzinger and others. The actor-singer made his debut at Met Gala 2025.

Malti cutely joins Priyanka Chopra, Nick Jonas's Met Gala photoshoot. See picsMany wondered what Priyanka and Nick's daughter Malti did while the couple attended the MET Gala. Well, Nick's latest pictures documented everything.

Chiranjeevi, Riteish Deshmukh, celebs react to Operation SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor and attacked nine terror sites in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir. Chiranjeevi, Kajal Aggarwal, Riteish Deshmukh and several celebrities have reacted to the mission.

Why Taylor Swift and Travis Kelce Skipped the 2025 Met GalaTaylor Swift and Travis Kelce skipped the 2025 Met Gala due to vacation plans. The couple prioritized downtime post-tour and NFL season over fashion's biggest night, despite growing anticipation.

Rihanna and Ciara end 14-year feud at 2025 Met Gala with heartfelt reunion Rihanna and Ciara ended their 14-year feud with a warm reunion at the 2025 Met Gala. The pop stars bonded over motherhood and fashion, celebrating Rihanna's third pregnancy.

A24 taps Alex Garland for dark fantasy Elden Ring film adaptationAlex Garland will direct a live-action Elden Ring film for A24, adapting the acclaimed fantasy RPG. Production is slated for 2026, marking Garland's next major cinematic project.

Adam Lambert to star as Judas in Jesus Christ superstar at Hollywood BowlAdam Lambert will star as Judas alongside Cynthia Erivo as Jesus in Jesus Christ Superstar at the Hollywood Bowl. The three-night production promises a bold, rock-infused theatrical experience.

Jennifer Aniston's Bel Air home hit by car in gate crash incidentA man was arrested after deliberately ramming his car into Jennifer Aniston's Bel Air home gate. No injuries occurred, and the motive remains under investigation, police confirmed on Tuesday.

Priyanka Chopra shines in diamond dress at Met Gala after-party with Nick JonasPriyanka Chopra dazzled in a diamond-studded mini dress at the Met Gala 2025 after-party, stealing the spotlight once again. Alongside husband Nick Jonas, the couple's stylish appearances became the talk of the internet.
100 days to go: Rajinikanth's Coolie countdown beginsThe makers of Rajinikanth-starrer 'Coolie' have released a new promo 100 days ahead of the release of Lokesh Kanagaraj's high-octane action film.

Tony Kakkar, Shaan extend support to Sonu Nigam after Bengaluru concert rowSinger Tony Kakkar and Shaan defended Sonu Nigam after he received backlash, and a police complaint, over his remarks at a Bengaluru concert.

Neha Kakkar reacts to Melbourne concert controversy days after organiser's claimNeha Kakkar has responded to allegations that she skipped her Melbourne concert due to low turnout, sharing a video of a lively performance to counter the claims. The controversy continues as event organisers alleged she refused to perform because of the crowd size.

Karthik Subbaraj on his next after Retro: Want to make an indie filmAfter directing high-budget films like 'Retro,' director Karthik Subbaraj has revealed his plans to direct an indie film, a low-budget project featuring new artists.

Bling denied: Why Diljit Dosanjh didn't wear Rs 21,000 crore necklace to Met GalaDiljit Dosanjh made a powerful Met Gala debut in a regal Prabal Gurung outfit inspired by the Maharaja of Patiala. His team's attempt to borrow the Maharaja's iconic Rs 21,000 crore Cartier necklace was denied, leading them to commission custom jewellery instead.

Trump's 100% tariff on foreign films, and what it means for Indian CinemaWill the Indian film industry be impacted by Donald Trump's policy involving a 100 per cent tariff on foreign films in the US? We spoke to the industry experts to understand the US President's decision, and the respective action to be taken.

general news.headline:
Here's proof. Video shows Jaish den in Bahawalpur turned to rubble in Op SindoorIn a massive counter-terror operation, India has carried out a precision strike on Markaz Subhan Allah — the key headquarters and training camp of Pakistan-based terror outfit Jaish-e-Mohammed (JeM) — reducing the facility to rubble.

Located in Bahawalpur in Pakistan, the compound was reportedly a nerve centre of terrorist activities, serving as both an ideological base and a training ground for JeM operatives. The targeted strike is being seen as a firm message in response to ongoing cross-border threats and militant infiltration attempts. The extent of damage is said to be substantial, leaving the once-bustling hub in complete ruins.

Indicate left, turn right: PM Modi's art of deception Pakistan failed to noticeBefore both Balakot and "Operation Sindoor", PM Modi kept public appearances routine, speeches calm, and intent hidden — masking precision strikes behind a poker face that Pakistan failed to read twice.

Scalp, Hammer: Why these were India's weapons of choice to hit Pak terror campsOperation Sindoor: Rafale jets armed with SCALP cruise missiles and HAMMER precision-guided munitions were used for the strikes on terror camps in Pakistan.

No terror camps in Pak? Journalist fact-checks minister on air after India strikesPakistani I&B Minister Attaullah Tarar was challenged by journalist Yalda Hakim on live television after claiming there are no terror camps in Pakistan.

Operation Sindoor: In the name is India's message, both humane and heroicIndia hit terror targets in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (POK) in pre-dawn strikes on Wednesday. It named it Operation Sindoor. Not just the strikes, even the name of the mission is supposed to convey a message to the world.

India's Rafale vs Pak's F-16: Air power in focus after Operation SindoorThe success of Operation Sindoor reveals a clear technological and operational edge for India when India's Rafale and Pakistan's F-16 series jets are put head to head.

Military strikes in Pak regrettable: China urges both sides to remain calmChina has termed India's airstrikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir 'regrettable' and urged both sides to exercise restraint and avoid further escalation.

Indian airspace being monitored, it's a national emergency: Government sourcesFollowing India's retaliatory strikes on terror targets in Pakistan and POK, flight operations at five northern airports have been suspended, triggering widespread travel disruptions.

Funded by bin Laden, trained Ajmal Kasab: Why India hit LeT's Muridke MarkazEstablished in 2000 and allegedly funded in part by Osama bin Laden with a contribution of Rs 10 million, the Masjid wa Markaz Taiba in Pakistan's Muridke is central to the Hafiz Saeed-led terror outfit's operations.

Response to brutal killing of our innocent brothers: Amit Shah on Op SindoorHome Minister Amit Shah was hard-hitting in his first reaction to 'Operation Sindoor', in which India struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation to the Pahalgam carnage. Taking to X, he tweeted that the operation was in response to the brutal killing of "innocent brothers".

Op Sindoor: S Jaishankar is blunt, says world must show zero tolerance for terrorIn a blunt, first reaction to 'Operation Sindoor', External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said the "world must show zero tolerance for terrorism" as India struck nine terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir in retaliation to the Pahalgam massacre in which terrorists killed 26 people.

Donald Trump says he knew India would retaliate, hopes it ends quicklyReacting to India's airstrikes under Operation Sindoor, US President Donald Trump called the situation "a shame" and urged India and Pakistan to de-escalate tensions, saying, "Nobody wants to see two powerful nations going down that road."

Uri, Pulwama, and now Pahalgam: India's message to Pak is loud and clearJust 15 days after the Pahalgam terror attack, India carried out strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and POK. Previously, India had launched similar operations in 2016 following the Uri attack, and in 2019 in response to the Pulwama attack.

This is bare minimum: Congress leader questions impact of Operation SindoorWhile the Congress leadership was unanimous in praising the armed forces for Operation Sindoor, Congress leader Rashid Alvi struck a discordant note.

Calculated, measured show of force: How foreign media reported Operation SindoorWhile Operation Sindoor was a significant military operation, it was equally a strategic exercise in shaping global perception. Most international media echoed the Indian stance that this was a calibrated counter-terror strike rather than an act of aggression.

Jaish headquarters, Lashkar camp: Why India chose these 9 terror targetsIn India's deepest cross-border strikes since Balakot, nine terror camps in Pakistan and POK were hit under "Operation Sindoor", including Jaish-e-Mohammad's Bahawalpur base and Lashkar's Muridke facility.

Damaged buildings, mosques and blackout in terror camps: Operation Sindoor in picsIn retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack, India on Wednesday conducted precision strikes on nine terror camps across Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir (PoK).

Hint before the storm: Army's video minutes before Op Sindoor announcementThe precision missile attacks, named Operation Sindoor, were carried out on nine terror targets, including in Punjab's Bhawalpur, the stronghold of Jaish-e-Mohammad.

Sensex, Nifty today: Why stock market didn't crash after 'Operation Sindoor'While markets remain extremely volatile, swinging between green and red, there was no major crash. Here are three reasons why Dalal Street remained calm after 'Operation Sindoor'.

Do not escalate: India's message for Pakistan after cross-border strikesIndia promised to act against the perpetrators of the Pahalgam massacre, and it fulfilled that with pre-dawn, cross-border strikes on Wednesday. However, it sent out a message that it targeted only terror, and not military, infrastructure, in a cautionary note to Pakistan against any escalation of the confrontation. India, however, has been preparing for all eventualities.

The longest papal election in Church history lasted 1,006 days, from 1268 to 1271The longest papal election in the history of the Church took place from 1268 to 1271 CE. It involved a clash between two powerful factions, and even the ordinary people became part of the unfolding drama. Here's a glimpse into that historic episode.

India attacks 9 terror camps in Pak, POK: Read Army full statement on Operation SindoorIndia launched Operation Sindoor, conducting precise airstrikes on nine terror-linked sites in Pakistan and PoK in response to the Pahalgam attack, targeting militant infrastructure.
Bharat Mata Ki Jai: Leaders hail Army after strikes on terror camps in PakistanIndia carried out precision strikes on terror camps in Pakistan and Pakistan Occupied Kashmir post midnight on April 7.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

sports.headline: MI will treat every game as playoffs now: Mahela JayawardeneMumbai Indians lost to Gujarat Titans in a rain-affected game on Tuesday. The loss complicated Mumbai's  chances of qualifying for the IPL playoffs.

Mumbai Indians must win both games to control their destiny in IPL 2025: KumbleFormer India captain and coach Anil Kumble has explained the qualification scenarios for both Mumbai Indians (MI) and Gujarat Titans (GT) after the rain-marred IPL 2025 thriller at the Wankhede.

Hardik Pandya not bowling final over can cost MI place in playoff: Sunil GavaskarIndia great Sunil Gavaskar has slammed Mumbai Indians' captain Hardik Pandya for giving the final over to Deepak Chahar after GT secured a three-wicket win under the Duckworth-Lewis-Stern (DLS) method to go on top of the IPL points table.

Operation Sindoor: Gambhir welcomes India's strikes on Pakistan terror campsThe cricketing fraternity of India showed strong support after India conducted precision strikes in Pakistan and Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir at midnight on May 7. Operation Sindoor is estimated to have eliminated 80 terrorists through coordinated attacks.

Hansi Flick fumes over refereeing decisions after Champions League exitBarcelona's Champions League journey ended after a dramatic semi-final defeat against Inter Milan. Controversial referee decisions sparked outrage amongst Barcelona fans including coach Hansi Flick.

MI vs GT: Sunil Gavaskar honours Shubman Gill with Player of the Match for captaincyIn a rain-affected thriller at Wankhede, Shubman Gill showcased maturity with the bat and sharp leadership on the field to steer Gujarat Titans to a narrow three-wicket DLS win over Mumbai Indians, ending their six-match winning streak.

Hardik Pandya rues multiple no-balls in MI's loss to GT: A crime in T20sMI skipper Hardik Pandya rued the multiple no-balls his side bowled during their loss to GT at the Wankhede stadium on Tuesday, May 6. MI's winning streak was halted by GT, who moved to the top of the table.

Champions League: Inter Milan break Barcelona hearts in thriller, reach finalInter Milan reached the Champions League final after a dramatic 4-3 extra-time win over Barcelona, in the semi-final second leg at San Siro. Late goals from Francesco Acerbi and Davide Frattesi completed Inter's comeback on a night of high drama.

IPL 2025: GT win rain-affected thriller to hurt MI's playoff hopesIn a rain-curtailed thriller at Wankhede, Gujarat Titans edged past Mumbai Indians via DLS, snapping MI's winning streak. Despite GT's top-order brilliance, it was Rahul Tewatia and Gerald Coetzee who sealed the tense final-over win under pressure.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli for England Tests? BCCI secretary shares selection updateIndia tour of England: The squad for the five-Test series in England is set to be announced before the final of IPL 2025, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia said. The five-Test series will get underway from June 20.

MI vs GT: Sunil Gavaskar honours Shubman Gill with Player of the Match for captaincyIn a rain-affected thriller at Wankhede, Shubman Gill showcased maturity with the bat and sharp leadership on the field to steer Gujarat Titans to a narrow three-wicket DLS win over Mumbai Indians, ending their six-match winning streak.

Hardik Pandya rues multiple no-balls in MI's loss to GT: A crime in T20sMI skipper Hardik Pandya rued the multiple no-balls his side bowled during their loss to GT at the Wankhede stadium on Tuesday, May 6. MI's winning streak was halted by GT, who moved to the top of the table.

Champions League: Inter Milan break Barcelona hearts in thriller, reach finalInter Milan reached the Champions League final after a dramatic 4-3 extra-time win over Barcelona, in the semi-final second leg at San Siro. Late goals from Francesco Acerbi and Davide Frattesi completed Inter's comeback on a night of high drama.

IPL 2025: GT win rain-affected thriller to hurt MI's playoff hopesIn a rain-curtailed thriller at Wankhede, Gujarat Titans edged past Mumbai Indians via DLS, snapping MI's winning streak. Despite GT's top-order brilliance, it was Rahul Tewatia and Gerald Coetzee who sealed the tense final-over win under pressure.

Rohit Sharma, Virat Kohli for England Tests? BCCI secretary shares selection updateIndia tour of England: The squad for the five-Test series in England is set to be announced before the final of IPL 2025, BCCI secretary Devajit Saikia said. The five-Test series will get underway from June 20.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
